original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū ṭhitā nisinnassa dhammaṁ desenti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū ṭhitāḥ nisinnassa dhammaṃ desenti pe
translated: at that time the monks from the group of six were teaching the Teaching to someone sitting while they were standing. …

original: “Na ṭhito nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṁ desessāmīti sikkhā karaṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: na ṭhitaḥ nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammam desessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: ‘“I will not teach the Teaching to anyone sitting while I’m standing, except if I’m sick,” this is how you should train.’”

original: Na ṭhitena nisinnassa agilānassa dhammo desetabbo.🔽Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca ṭhito nisinnassa agilānassa dhammaṁ deseti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.🔽Anāpatti—🔽asañcicca …pe…
analyzed: na ṭhitena nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammaḥ desetabbo  yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca ṭhitaḥ nisinnassa a gilānassa dhammaṃ deseti āpatti dukkaṭassa  anāpatti  a san cit ca pe
translated: One should not teach the Teaching to anyone sitting while one is standing, except if one is sick.🔽If a monk, out of disrespect, teaches the Teaching to someone sitting while he is standing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
There is no offense if he does not intend to do it; if he is the first offender; if he is insane; if he is the first offender.
The tenth training rule is finished.
